title: What are the requirements to become an air traffic controller? - Quora
tags: Jobs and Careers in Air Traffic Control

response.answer_text: In the USA, to be a civilian controller with the FAA you need three years of general (progressively responsible) full-time work experience. Pretty much any “real” job experience will qualify you. You can substitute a 4-year college/university degree (any field) for this work experience. Going to college/university for the sole purpose of becoming a controller is, in my opinion, a waste of time and money.

I don't know which country you're from. But here are the requirements and procedures to become an air traffic controller in my country, India. If you're from India then this answer will be helpful for you.    How to become an Air Traffic Controller
